lines.text: Now, what can I do for you this beautiful day?
You can put lots of ice cream in my chocolate soda.
Alright, and you...?
Oh, I'll have a nut sundae.
Very appropriate. Just a moment.
That is, if you have any nuts?
Oh, we've got plenty of nuts.
Hey, son, hey, how about them drinks?
That'll be 30 birds feet, Mr. Rockefeller.
For what?
For what? Well, if Mrs. Flynn's only son isn't getting dumb. A nut sundae and a chocolate soda adds up to 30 whole pennies.
Well, there must be some mistake, good man. All I owe is 15 cents for the soda. I didn't order the nut sundae.
Well, hit me with a Mack truck!
I wonder what it is about that stunt pilot that gives all the dames the blind stagger.
Well, Bee, he's different than most guys. You know, he risks his life everyday. He's got nerves.
Oh, he's got nerve, alright.
Baby. How are you?
Fine.
Say, I've got more news to tell than a Sunday edition. Is there a spot around this joint were we can be alone?
Gosh, I wish you weren't going, darling.
Oh, but you love me, don't you?
Oh, so much, Ted, dear.
Well, then you certainly wouldn't want me to pass up an opportunity like this. Oh, come on, baby, buck up now.
I beg your pardon, I have been mistaken. I thought you were a man. Not just a cheap thrill-hunter, a cheap girl-chaser.
